channel.title: Runserver (linux)
channel.description: Does anyone have a .sh to run servers on linux?

item.title: Runserver (linux)
item.dc:creator: @leet leet
item.description:
@leet wrote:

Does the same thing

[biowow@server1 files]$ sh run.sh
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:268)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319)

[br][size=1]Posted on: November 02, 2007, 10:32:52 PM[/size][hr]It Also happens with any source i try… [br][size=1]Posted on: November 02, 2007, 11:14:01 PM[/size][hr]uuuuugggh so no one wants to help?? “Crys” “Crys”

item.title: Runserver (linux)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

FOR FUCK SAKES leet, I have told you a million times. DO NOT HAVE JAVA SERVER.CLASS

Replace your whole script with;
#!/bin/sh
java server
sleep 100

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver (linux)
item.dc:creator: @leet leet
item.description:
@leet wrote:

Can you help or not?

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver (linux)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“thiefmn6092, post:10, topic:156384”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=213358.msg1863461#msg1863461 date=1194077978]

[biowow@server1 files]$ ./run.sh
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server/class
sleep: missing operand
Try `sleep --help’ for more information.
[biowow@server1 files]$

Now the run.sh has

#!/bin/sh
java server.class
sleep

Replace java server.class with
java server.
So now have;
#!/bin/sh
java server.class
sleep(100000);
[/quote]

Uh, no?

sleep 100 [/quote]
Oops, forgot that is shell script syntax

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver (linux)
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:4, topic:156384”][quote author=thiefmn6092 link=topic=213358.msg1863214#msg1863214 date=1194073424]
You can just do what Yz85Racer said, or always install ANT with the package manager and make a quick buildfile and use that to compile & run everything, that’s what i do anyways.
[/quote]
Or, use Kate (Kubuntu’s defualt text editor) and set hotkeys to compile and run - that’s what I do.[/quote]

That works to, hehe.
